poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Offboarding (MIP39c3-SP2) - September 12, 2022

discourse_list.title: MIP39c3-SP2: Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Offboarding

content.content: MIP39c3-SP2: Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Offboarding  Preamble MIP39c3-SP#: 2 Author(s): @Codeknight Contributors: Tags: core-unit, SH-001, cu-offboarding Status: Rejected Date Applied: 2022-07-07 Date Ratified: N/A Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-spxx-modify-strategic-happiness-core-unit-budget-sh-001/16438 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/Qmc9Un8i   Sentence Summary MIP39c3-SP2 offboards the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001).  Paragraph Summary MIP39c3-SP2 offboards the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001).  Specification  Motivation The functions of SH-001 do not require a Core Unit. The budget is a significant outlier given the high cost and niche function. If swag is desired, it should be integrated into another CU or the service contracted to Core Units as needed. The Core Unit is an unnecessary expense and currently represents 64k in monthly costs. It is a substantial ongoing cost with unclear returns. The approval of this budget, which tripled during the last approval cycle, was contentious before the significant decline in protocol revenue and overall crypto market. With the current budget and protocol revenue, the protocol does not receive enough value to justify the expense. Additionally, tracking, management and reporting of SH-001 spending and progress on initiatives has been poor, which is especially concerning in a time when Core Units are under pressure to cut costs and justify expenditures. This Core Unit should be granted severance and offboarded.  Summary of Reason for Offboarding  Large budget that does not justify the narrow purpose of this Core Unit. Large deficit in Maker’s budget. Poor management of accounting and expense tracking. Swag does not require an entire Core Unit.   Explicit Deliverables and Responsibilities  Delivery of swag through various initiatives. Integration of AccountAble for account & expense tracking. Partnerships and collaborations across DeFi.   Implicit Deliverables and Responsibilities  Proper accounting and management of funds.   Examples of Unfulfilled Deliverables and Responsibilities  Ongoing account and expense tracking issues. This Core Unit has struggled with mixing of personal and business accounts, adding significant costs to untangle. Lack of notable partnerships or collaborations.   Core Unit Unwinding – Work N/A. No work needed.  Core Unit Unwinding – Funds Severance of 45K will be granted. This represents over a six-months salary for the Facilitator.  Possible Remedy to Avoid Offboarding N/A. If the work is desired, it should be contracted through another Core Unit or performed underneath another Core Unit. Swag can be worthwhile to the DAO, but not through its current structure.  Core Unit ID SH-001
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal for offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) due to its large budget that does not justify its narrow purpose, poor management of accounting and expense tracking, and lack of notable partnerships or collaborations. The proposal suggests severance of 45K and delivery of swag through various initiatives, but also mentions that swag does not require an entire Core Unit. The post does not ask for feedback or collaboration, and there is no advertising of the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None

content.content: Regardless of wether or not SH-001 requires or not to be a CU…     CodeKnight:  The functions of SH-001 do not require a Core Unit.   This is starting to feel like schizophrenia to me. Do we realise that this CU’s budget was approved just 2 months ago ???(link). @CodeKnight i am grateful you did this proposal, I am also for keeping budgets under check and, generally, for the ENDGAME plan. But this YES–> NO–> YES–> NO… behaviour is unacceptable:  It’s extremely wasteful in terms of governance bandwidth It creates a feeling of total insecurity for CUs  IMHO we need first to vote on a general/wide and well-defined “budgets cut operation” and, only subsequently, instantiate it to specific CUs. Just offboarding at a CU that was approved 2 months ago is not a professional way to go to me, without a general and well-defined plan.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: I do understand this concern, but I would also factor in how the decision was made. You can look over the discussion  and see that a remarkable amount of the support is based on personal ties and a generally feeling that aburban90 deserved it in an environment with low MKR participation. A more budget and metric focused voting pool will have come to a different decision. I do understand that this is difficult for aburban90 and would factor that into the golden parachute. Feedback on that is appreciated.

iammeeoh:  IMHO we need first to vote on a general/wide and well-defined “budgets cut operation” and, only subsequently, instantiate it to specific CUs.   That makes sense! This way of offboarding CUs feels targeted and personal. Instead if the DAO reviews and approves budget cuts via a governance mandate, we can vote on best ways to trim expenses with a goal in mind!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: iammeeoh:  Do we realise that this CU’s budget was approved just 2 months ago ???(link).   As stated here, for anyone even outside the DAO is something weird to see, now practically everyone will be looking at MakerDAO like some place where they will NEVER feel comfortable working, how is possible that just few months ago people voted for you to work, and in few weeks you’re being kicked out, doesn’t make any sense. Tbh, I also feel that yeah, SH should not be as expensive as it is, there are way lot more services that can provide Burban’s job with less money, but this is not the way. Maybe when budgets are approved should be some term/condition that the CU work will be under vigilance for 3-6 months, and if after that time seems that their mandate is not being achieve, then the community can proceed to an offboarding of the CU.

We must have the best result for the least possible money and from here we get nothing.

MIP39c3-SP2 aims to offboard the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001). If the offboarding proposal is ratified, the existing DAI and MKR vesting streams will be cancelled. content.content: Kinda agree, kinda disagree. I agree in the fact that the contribution from this CU may no appear as essential because it’s hard to measure the impact for the community and the DAO and you could say that it’s not bear market friendly. But the value is there, or at least it can be there, even more on bear markets with all this stress sentiments going around. On the other hand I agree with other members in the fact that this CU’s budget was approved very recently and offboarding it just because the market shifted doesn’t hit me as the right way to go. I think that core Units and PEOPLE working in them, need to have a little more stability in their working enviroments. If the DAO onboards and offboards Core Units so easily it gives the impression of inestabilty and will cost human resources to the DAO in the long run. Even a DAO needs to have some predictability I dont know, it’s just a thought.

content.content: This subproposal has been reworked into a MIP39c3 subproposal by the author to comply with the new Core Unit offboarding process. We’ve modified the subproposal name and code accordingly; we’ve also archived MIP41c5-SP9: SH-001 Facilitator Offboarding and marked it as withdrawn. Given that MIP39c3 subproposals now achieve as much as MIP40c3 and MIP41c5 subproposals did under the old scheme, this is considered a reworking rather than a new proposal and thus does not reset the feedback period for this proposal.

content.content: CodeKnight:  Core Unit Unwinding – Work N/A. No work needed.   I am curious as to how this was determined.  Was this derived from the facilitator? I ask because our CU relies on the work and budget allocation of SH-001.  Swag is a big staple to the DAIvinity events.  It is great for promotion.  Assuming this offboarding is submitted for September voting that means in the case it passes the funds this CU uses to produce swag will be cut off at the end of Sept.  We have an event in Bogota on Oct 13 and we would expect this CU to produce swag.  Why is there no winddown budget to cover this since it is so close to offboarding?  Also, I am surprised there is no fund allocation to wind down for accounting or other outstanding liabilities which may be involved     CodeKnight:  If swag is desired, it should be integrated into another CU or the service contracted to Core Units as needed.   From our CUs side swag is a very important promotional tool and we do desire it.  If this CU ceases to exist we would have to look at allocating a portion of our budget to cover swag at our events.

content.content: @CodeKnight  Maker community, After thinking about it for some time, and in the context of the greater move to restructure for the Endgame Plan, I will agree that my CU, in its current form, is not ideal. Regrettably, in the overall uncertainty, I have not been able to form a deal to merge under the Growth CU at this time. Nevertheless, I will be going forward with accepting an offboarding. I would propose a few things that I believe the community will find reasonable.   @CodeKnight’s severance offer for $45k is acceptable, but as I live in NY, I request that it be a post-tax sum, as It will make a difference in helping me meet living obligations going forward. This totals to $63.5k pre-tax.   I request that the existence of my CU be prolonged through the end of October so that I can fulfill some of my current commitments, which include our event in Bogota.   As a precedent regarding pro-rating vests has already been set, an equivalent treatment in my case would be appreciated.   Anyway, I wish everyone many thanks for granting me the opportunity to have been a facilitator. Thanks, Andrew Burban  One thing not covered above, if down the road there are legal fees or prison terms associated w/ having been a facilitator of a CU, I’d request some assistance from the DAO at that time.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I will be voting no on this proposal. The contributions by @aburban90 have been beyond tangible. DAI is more than a stablecoin and the Maker Protocol is more than a lending pool. MKR has outsized effects on the financial and political landscape of our future not because the math is sound or the governance is inclusive, but because it is a cleaver that severs the unholy union between money and state, Mammon and Moloch! It is no coincidence that the names of the tokens of our protocol are pronounced “Maker” and “Die”. It may have never been explicitly stated in the documentation, but anyone with a functioning soul can decipher the symbolism. This is a holy, non-religious organization, made in the image of The Dude who Generates, Organizes, and Destroys. It should be obvious why MakerDAO should retain its “Chief Happiness Officer” and continue observation of DAIvinity. But if it’s not, I’ll explain. A DAO is not a business, it’s a tribe. Tribes do business internally and externally, but they are more than mere businesses. If a tribe myopically focuses on business concerns, the tribe will disintegrate. Technically, using the “8 Forms of Capital” model, a business maximizes financial capital; whereas, a tribe maximizes all forms of capital. And, with the exception of genocide events, tribes always outlive businesses. So, to the tribe of MakerDAO, I say this: retain your shaman in the role of “Chief Happiness Officer” and keep the regular observance of DAIvinity. For if you don’t, someone, likely a “public-private partnership preaching” fascist will come into our house and flip our tables.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Let’s not be rash offboarding SHCU! Is this how we thank our people for their hard work? Is this what being a prolific contributor to our cause gets you? A kick to the curb and a finger in your face–and not the thumb, index, ring, or pinky. This proposal should be considered unacceptable by anyone who got into crypto to get away from facist central government bs and disgusting corporate greed of traditional finance.

content.content: Couldn’t agree more with the sentiment of tribe > company. Beyond the importance of swag distribution mechanisms and acquisition metrics, there is an invisible churn of both known and unknown participants throughout any community. @aburban90 has done everything in his power to bolster the community for both new and old members. Framing his role within the bounds of simple swag delivery is a gross misjudgment of the unquantifiable but very real network effects that his efforts have created over these last few years. True social capital is earned with time and trust - a compound interest not easily replaced.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Nobody disagrees that @aburban90 has done a great job of building goodwill across the Maker community and has earned plenty of appreciation (as the comments and posts above demonstrate), but offboarding SH is hardly “facist central government BS”. @CodeKnight has conducted this process in good faith and has repeatedly reached out to Burban, including around severance - he shouldn’t be vilified here. The truth is that it’s hard for a DAO to justify providing compensation and a budget for unquantifiable network effects or evangelism (plenty of other community members might ask for the same). That isn’t a reflection on Burban personally, or his contributions to date.

content.content: Matt_NZ:  @CodeKnight has conducted this process in good faith and has repeatedly reached out to Burban, including around severance - he shouldn’t be vilified here.   What baffles 3F Delegate here is the negotiating amounts offered by said Delegate without the blessing of both the MakerDAO community (via a SR) and MKR token owners via the Governance process. Never in my wildest dreams would 3F Delegate make monetary offers to a Core Unit team member without the consent of MKR token owners. What monetary amount constitutes “Good Faith”? There’s a time and point where delegates need to draw the line — and attempting to negotiate compensation monetary amount on behalf of MKR token owners without their prior approval is in my honest opinion—not a good practice.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party auditing and reviewing proposal

content.content: Isn’t RFC part of the governance process? I included the amount on August 8 and have received no concerns on it from any delegate or MKR holder until today. I cannot find any precedent or guidelines for using an SR to determine the amount of compensation to include in a MIP39c3 proposal. Had I known this was a concern, I would have been happy to do such consultation.

@CodeKnight I believe your approach was wrong. Negotiating with the facilitator in question via a call without prior-consent of MKR token owners does not constitute to me, the true definition of DAO. But I guess you, others, and I are built differently. What can I tell you.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

Also as @CodeKnight mentioned, it’s also difficulty of assessing exactly how the money went that the governance needs to think about. For example, after SH CU secured an increased budget, it was supposed to include compensation for hiring a part time role. I don’t think I seen such person on the forum. It’s one thing to defend someone of committed to the protocol but as a Delegate, if we vote soley based on emotional attachments, that’s corruption so no, I don’t feel ashamed as some suggested.

Also as @CodeKnight mentioned, it’s also difficulty of assessing exactly how the money went that the governance needs to think about. For example, after SH CU secured an increased budget, it was supposed to include compensation for hiring a part time role. I don’t think I seen such person on the forum.   Again, it is my belief that the value the MKR community receives from @aburban90’s engagement, crpyto activism, and enthusiastic support of the protocol represents value worth well above the $1m discretionary spend that has been allocated to him. He isn’t being personally compensated with $1m, he is spending it on behalf of the community and frankly it’s been on things we collectively have enjoyed as a product of his personal creativity. He works tirelessly. He personally had awakened Nikolai to save the protocol from the LOVE proposal. To cast him aside now is spitting in the face of the community and communicates to everyone that being a zealous advocate and hard worker means nothing to no one as long as it appears to save a couple of bucks.
